job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Paul, MN
pros: People, Values, Compensation, Work/Life Balance
cons: The dress code for non-patient facing staff is very exclusionary for both plus size people and those without disposable incomes. Business dress is expected, rather than business casual which would include blue jeans, which makes getting dressed for work in an office setting very difficult. You'd be surprised how difficult and expensive going to work can get when a nice clean pair of blue jeans isn't allowed for working in cubicle.

review_title: Therapy Manager Gaslights Employees to Quit
job_title: Physical Therapist in Saint Paul, MN
pros: My co-workers there were some of the most genuine and kind people.
cons: My manager, who has been there for decades, targets employees and gaslights them until they quit. I think this term is called quietly firing - quiet firing happens when managers allow employees to have truly toxic or miserable experiences at work as a way to squeeze them out. It's a form of gaslighting. When managers fail to adequately provide coaching, support and career development to an employee, which results in pushing the employee out of an organization.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Truly some of the best co-workers and RNs you'll ever work with. I left to go to another hospital and miss the culture at Gillette. It's small enough to know everybody, so it's a tight-knit group. Great teamwork on the inpatient side. The doctors respect nursing and the medical director checks in on the inpatient units which is impressive.
cons: I left during COVID when most of us were furloughed, which (although yes, of course unprecedented), was just dealt with in an awful and unprofessional way, there was no staff protection, we had no idea what was going on, there was no communication, and I was not interested in staying somewhere where I felt so unappreciated and undervalued.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Gillette is truly dedicated to providing the best experience for our patients. From the maintenance staff up to the Therapists and Physicians- everyone seems to love what they do and enjoys being a part of this organization. Gillette compensates their employees well and there is room for advancement within. Working directly with the Physicians is truly a rewarding job to have.
cons: The scheduling department is a major downfall at Gillette for both patients and Gillette staff. The scheduling system is not working. The department overall has low morale, poor training/ operational documents, and in general poor management and attitude.

review_title: Surrounded by amazing families and compasionate employees, every day filled me with pride and purpose!
job_title: Media Relations in Saint Paul, MN
pros: There is a great mission being carried out within the walls of the building.  Highly trained people are helping families and children deal with conditions that, in some cases, no one has ever seen before.  It is an honor to be a part of this group.
cons: Seeing what others are going through can tear at you emotionally.  The pediatric intensive care unit is sometimes hard to be in, due to the children who are there.  Overall, working there just makes it very hard to complain about the things in your life...

job_title: Patient Access Specialist in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Benefits are good, pay can be decent IF you negotiate well in your interview
cons: the Patient Access department is a revolving door.  It's a call center environment, which is not everyone's cup of tea. The work can be tedious/boring. The biggest con is management - it's very poor. Lack of follow through/follow up, demanding and strict to the point of unreasonableness.
